subject: Home & DIY
title: Sensors: The Nervous System of Smart Homes
description: A quick, practical guide to Sensors: The Nervous System of Smart Homes.

hook.text: A smart home without sensors is like a brain without eyes. Sensors give a house the ability to perceive.

buildup.text: Motion sensors detect presence. Door sensors track openings. Temperature, humidity, and light sensors watch conditions.

discovery.text: Occupancy sensors go beyond motionâ€”they detect whether someone is sitting still using mmWave radar or thermal imaging.

twist.text: The cheapest upgrades are sensors, not gadgets. A $15 contact sensor can tell you if you left the garage open.

climax.text: Layering sensors creates context: motion + time + light = 'someone woke at 2 AM, turn on dim hallway lights.'

punchline.text: Smart homes don't thinkâ€”they feel, then react.

quiz.question: How do occupancy sensors differ from basic motion sensors?

They only activate in rooms larger than 20 square meters
